Description: Fragment of wall of Attic black-figured pottery open vase. Inside glazed. Exterior: Dionysos to left, holding drinking-horn; red in his wreath; to left some remains of drapery, though its level suggest that Dionysos may be seated, or the drapery may belong to a maenad being carried by a satyr.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: This sherd is labelled in pencil Φ5 (however the first character is obscured and unclear), designating this as coming from a context excavated by Petrie within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, during Gardner’s excavations at Naukratis in 1885-1886.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2200)
